title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00923[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00923 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Mid 2017 4xTBT3 TB whose model number is <s>[INST] [MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]A1706[/MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]: A1706 is a model number for a 13" size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923. [/INST]</s> with a screen size of 13" and an EMC number of EMC 3163 [/INST]</s> - no display
message:
Water damaged. Ok on external display but blank screen on internal lcd also on test lcd.

[SIGNAL_NAMES]PP5V_S0SW_LCD[/SIGNAL_NAMES] 0V. Any idea?

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00923[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00923 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Mid 2017 4xTBT3 TB whose model number is <s>[INST] [MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]A1706[/MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]: A1706 is a model number for a 13" size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923. [/INST]</s> with a screen size of 13" and an EMC number of EMC 3163 [/INST]</s> - no display
message:
Any liquid sign on LCD connector?
CPU eDP output has no protection at all, directly connected to J8500.

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00923[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00923 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Mid 2017 4xTBT3 TB whose model number is <s>[INST] [MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]A1706[/MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]: A1706 is a model number for a 13" size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923. [/INST]</s> with a screen size of 13" and an EMC number of EMC 3163 [/INST]</s> - no display
message: There is a pin burnt in lcd connector on lcd side and on connector cable. Replaced it and tried with test lcd but it's like it is not recognised. I'm thinking to lift [CHIPS]U8510[/CHIPS] and measure  <s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is necessary to enable the power rail that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high.  [/INST]</s>. I can't se other ways to do it.

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00923[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00923 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Mid 2017 4xTBT3 TB whose model number is <s>[INST] [MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]A1706[/MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]: A1706 is a model number for a 13" size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923. message:
"There is a pin burnt in lcd connector"
Which pin corresponds in schematic?

You can still arm a big iMac using a 42" TV...

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00923[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00923 fits a MacBook Pro Retina computer from year Mid 2017 4xTBT3 TB whose model number is <s>[INST] [MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]A1706[/MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]: A1706 is a model number for a 13" size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923. [/INST]</s> with a screen size of 13" and an EMC number of EMC 3163 [/INST]</s> - no display
message: Just measured the LVDS cable connector. It is pin 1 ([SIGNAL_NAMES]EDP_INT_AUX_N[/SIGNAL_NAMES]).There is only 80ohm between pin 1 and the next pin 43 (<s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim. [/INST]</s>).

message:
Classic overvoltage from backlight output.
If you cannot change CPU, think about mentioned iMac option...
